file_content.text: I'm too young to be a queen, anyway.
There is nothing more I can do. The disease has spread to your heart.
I wasn't using it anyway. Besides, our captain has returned.
You made it!
Open this thing before it's too late.
Give me the reliquary. I want to see these treasures before I die....
This box belonged to a King Arak Drayen. Relative of yours?
Family heirlooms?
My grandfather. A usurper stole his throne, but he got the last laugh. Drayens always do.
The Long Shadow was quite a place. I have no plans to go back.
They were hard to get.
You've seen the end of all things, Captain--the darkness waiting to embrace us.
I buried Skavak in that black hole, by the way. Long story.
Skavak's dead.
Who is Skavak?
He's nobody.
I'll enter the code my father taught me, and... there. Such a simple act to fulfill a lifetime of effort.
Congratulations, Captain. Nok Drayen's lost fortune is yours.
With one exception. Take the crown, Risha. Claim your birthright.
Restore the Drayen dynasty as rulers of Dubrillion. Wear the crown and rule that world.
Your whole crazy treasure hunt has been to get some kingdom back?
You people are royalty?
Our kingdom--and revenge on the usurpers who stole our throne.
If anyone here is going to rule, it'll be me.
Give me that crown.
For our bloodline, it's a key to power. For you, it's a hunk of metal.
Remember those assassins on Tatooine? They were sent by the current king of Dubrillion to end me.
This king isn't going to roll over just because you have the crown.
You're in for a fight.
The Crown of Dubrillion commands the respect of millions. She'll have plenty of allies.
Will they be enough, Father? Can I really do this?
Why didn't you tell me that back on Tatooine?
This was your big secret?
The less people who knew the truth, the better. You saw what happened to my friend Audila, and she didn't know anything.
Don't concern yourself with the fates of others. You have more important things to worry about.
What you need is a new king--and I know just the guy.
[Flirt] I have an idea....
You're volunteering? I'm shocked.
This conversation is absurd. My daughter will marry a nobleman.
If he could see how weak you are, he wouldn't have bothered.
He's worried over nothing.
The captain makes a fascinating point.
Hand over the box and give me what's mine.
Big deal--pay me.
If you're going to rule a world, Risha, you'll have to do questionable things. This is my final lesson to you.
The spacer has fulfilled her purpose. Dispose of her and keep the reliquary's treasures for yourself.
Is that how you reward a girl's loyalty, Nok?
How rude.
Loyalty had nothing to do with your actions. You're a common mercenary. The galaxy is full of trash like you.
In the grand scheme of things, one spacer is meaningless. Keep the reliquary and its wealth. Kill him.
Kill me, just like your grandfather killed the crew of that ship?
It's the family way, right?
This wealth is destined for royalty, not usurpers or fortune hunters.
Your daughter likes me too much to kill me.
[Flirt] Risha won't do that.
Emotions are a distraction, Risha.
Try anything, and you're all dead.
I'll kill you.
I... I want no part of this! I do not want to die!
Shut up, you fool.
No, Father. I won't kill her. She's my friend.
Father, no. The captain is a good man. I care about him.
I've betrayed too many people already, Father. The captain earned this reward.
You... useless child! Spent too many years without my guidance. You're weak... powerless!
Everything I've done... the blood I've spilled... for nothing! This isn't how it's supposed to end....
His life signs have ceased. I am sorry.
Dispose of my father's body as he instructed, Doctor Chelah. You're released from my family's service.
I'm sorry you had to see that, Captain. My father was sick.
I appreciate you not trying to kill me.
Glad we're still friends.
After all you've done, that would've been highly ungrateful.
You don't owe me any apologies.
Don't worry about it.
He was a pathetic pile of scum.
I'm glad he's dead.
He didn't leave any mourners.
You're a wealthy woman, Captain. That reliquary holds more than just family heirlooms. Merchants will be killing each other to buy what you're selling.
You're a wealthy man, Captain. That reliquary holds more than just family heirlooms. Merchants will be killing each other to buy what you're selling.
Not sure what I'm supposed to do, now. Everyone I've met from Dubrillion has tried to kill me.
I don't have an army or a starfleet. I'm supposed to take over a whole planet with just a crown?
I'm sure we'll come up with a brilliant plan, Your Highness.
And friends.
I have a feeling you're just in it for the money--but I can live with that.
Want a job fixing my ship while you work out the details?
I need a good mechanic.
Your engines probably need a good tuning after that last trip. I'll take the job.
Sounds fun--and profitable.
I'll help for the right price.
Just don't expect any fancy titles out of this... "partner."
I'm glad red-mane is staying with us.
Figures you'd be sticking around, Risha. You're like a mynock that way.
I'll make sure all the right people hear what you did today, Captain. It's the least I can do.
Besides, famous starship captains attract profitable opportunities, and queens-in-training can never have too many credits. Let's hit the hyperlanes.
My father and I have catching up to do. Good luck in the Long Shadow.
Sorry I wasn't completely honest, Captain.
I promised father when he entered Doctor Chelah's hibernation treatment I'd never tell anyone the truth.
Why was Nok in carbonite for ten years?
Hibernation treatment?
The Selkath's experimental carbon freezing allowed me to cheat death--at least, for a little while.
You're a good liar, I'll give you that.
You kept your promise.
You've never been straight with me, have you?
What else did you lie about?
Trust is a vice for the weak. I learned that the hard way.
Ten years ago, one of my lieutenants deliberately infected me with a disease. It's deadly, incurable--and eating me alive.
I'm a fortune hunter, not a doctor.
I can't help you with that.
I don't need a doctor anymore--but I do need a fortune hunter.
What happened to your henchman?
And the lieutenant?
Dead, of course. I killed all my men, just to be sure I avenged myself on every traitor.
You replaced the infected parts with all that machinery, right?
That's why you're a cyborg.
I've done everything to stop this disease, but it's never been enough. Soon, the illness will consume my vital organs.
Rumor is, Jedi can heal anything.
I've heard Jedi can help.
The Jedi proved uncooperative. I killed three trying to learn their secrets. But that is not our present concern.
Then there's no time to waste.
Yell if your mind starts to go, all right?
Like your brain?
Let's get down to business, shall we?
I lied about my father, Captain, but not his lost fortune. That's real--and thanks to all those starship upgrades, it's yours.
You have the only starship in the galaxy equipped to travel where the fortune was lost. No one else can reach it.
There is a region of space beyond the Outer Rim called the Long Shadow. There are no stars, no light, no life....
Just a derelict starship drifting into a massive black hole. My fortune waits for you there.
I'm sorry, did you say "massive black hole"?
I knew there was a catch.
Few spacers have seen the Long Shadow and survived. They describe it as a vast darkness, slowly consuming the galaxy.
You seem awfully certain.
The starship in question has belonged to my family for a very long time.
And what do you want on that ship?
That can't be all.
Very perceptive, but material wealth no longer concerns me.
I'll give you the coordinates to the derelict vessel. You'll fly into the Long Shadow and board it.
Retrieve the vessel's reliquary and bring it here. Risha will take a single item. The rest is yours.
I don't even know what "reliquary" means.
Reliquary?
Think of it as a treasure chest filled with the sort of wealth that never goes out of style.
Tell me about this "single item" Risha gets.
What's Risha taking?
A simple piece of ornamentation. It has no value to you.
If you think I'm coming back here, you're crazy.
Wrong--it's all mine.
I'm afraid that I'm the only one who can open the reliquary.
My daughter will stay here. I have things to tell her, and my time grows short.
I'd wish you good luck, but I know you don't need it.
Next stop, the Long Shadow.
Guess I'll be going.
Be careful out there. I've gotten used to seeing you.
Enjoy your family reunion. I'm off to get rich.
You two have fun.
You ready for the ride of your life, farm boy?
Come on, Corso.
Can't believe we're doing this.
I might just need a Wookiee in the Long Shadow.
You ready, Bowdaar?
I'm ready for anything.
I'll always come back for you, Risha.
[Flirt] I'll be back.
The derelict vessel is at these coordinates. Go now.
This is a big moment, Captain--bigger than you probably realize. I've waited ten years for it.
What is this place?
Where are we?
A private medical facility. So private, it's only ever served one patient.
Is the fish head our buyer?
I see we're not alone.
Not exactly. He's here to oversee the delivery.
Is this the part where you stab me in the back?
Here comes the betrayal.
After all this time, you still don't trust me? There's hope for you yet.
Doctor Chelah, let's introduce the captain to the man in carbonite. Begin the procedure.
Initiating carbon thawing and resuscitation. You may wish to shield your eyes....
Vital signs are normal. He is regaining consciousness.
How long has it been?
Ten years. I'm sorry it took so long, but I finally have everything you told me to find.
Come closer, Risha. Let me see you.
I'm different, now.
Not that little girl constantly underfoot. Now you're my heir... my legacy.
Captain, meet my father... Nok Drayen. I believe I've mentioned him once or twice.
Nok Drayen? I heard you were dead.
That's impossible.
I was dead. Now I'm not.
I never believed you were really dead, Nok.
I knew it!
Then my daughter wasn't doing her job properly.
Heard a lot about you, Nok. If you're not dead, were those other stories made-up, too?
Were all those stories true?
What does it matter, if people believe them?
Bring the man in carbonite so we can finish our deal, Captain. We're so close to our goal.
No one has ever come as close to finding Nok Drayen's riches as we are now.
How will you spend all that reward when you finally get it?
What will you do with your share?
Tell me your plans, first.
Ask me again when I have it.
I was thinking I might hire an army of Wookiees.
I'll buy something ridiculous.
What you lack in practicality, you make up in style.
None of your business.
Who'd have thought you'd be uncomfortable discussing money.
Your last job is taking the man in carbonite to these coordinates. It's a restricted area. Only us and the buyer will be there.
That's right, I'll help you negotiate this deal personally. But don't worry--I'm sure you'll do most of the talking.
We're finally teaming up, huh? Interesting.
You're coming along?
The terms of the deal are very specific. If I'm not there, you don't get paid.
Who are we gonna be dealing with?
Tell me about the buyer.
I'd tell you if I could, but this particular buyer prefers to remain anonymous.
What's my payment?
Your reward is the secret location of Nok Drayen's riches. No fooling.
I'll run ahead and make sure everything's in place. Meet me there with our friend in the carbonite.
Use this access card to enter the restricted area. I'll see you at the delivery point.
Have to give credit where it's due, Captain. You've done an amazing job delivering this cargo. Always knew you would.
We've had quite a ride.
It's been fun.
It's not over yet.
Skavak never would've gotten you this far.
You hired the best.
And he would have pawed at me the whole trip. I definitely traded up.
I can do lots of amazing things for you, if you'll let me.
[Flirt] We're a great team.
You're also not easily discouraged.
I am pretty amazing.
It's even harder for the rest of us.
We only have one delivery left to make, Captain. Set course for Nar Shaddaa.
I'm ready to leave this dustball in my rear thrusters.
With pleasure.
That makes two of us.
I thought we'd finished our business on Nar Shaddaa.
Again?
I needed time to set up this deal. I'll explain when we get there.
We'll leave as soon as I wrap up some business.
I'm not finished here yet.
Don't take forever. We're centimeters away from finding Nok Drayen's fortune.
What, are you lost? Cheenee Rift is thataway.
Juran? I haven't seen you in forever. I'd love to catch up, but this isn't the best time.
Someone took Audila. Said I'll get her back in pieces if you don't come. Pieces! You have to help me!
This guy a friend of yours?
I'm feeling a little lost.
I've known him and his wife since we were kids.
Wait, let me guess: someone is in trouble, and you're going to ask me to help.
Here we go again...
You're a quick study, Captain.
We don't have time for this. Cut the transmission.
This isn't our problem.
Juran, I won't let anything happen to you or Audila. Calm down and start over.
When I came home from work, Audila was gone. There was a man waiting for me.
He said unless you want to be responsible for Audila's death, you'll meet him at an old Czerka mining complex in the Cheenee Rift.
I don't understand, Risha. Why is this happening?
It's a trap, obviously. But my odds of surviving and getting Audila back alive are a lot better if you help me spring it.
This is going to cost you.
My help isn't free.
Fine, but you don't get anything until Audila is safe.
You'd better have a good plan.
You'll need more than that.
I like your sentimental side.
[Flirt] You're a big softie.
Enjoy it while it lasts. I only show it once a year.
Count me out.
Let me make this easy for you. You'll never find Nok Drayen's fortune without me. Now are you gonna help or not?
I don't believe you'd sacrifice Nok's treasure for your friend.
I think you're bluffing.
How badly do you want to find out?
If I risk my neck for your friend, I expect to be well-paid.
You'll owe me--big time.
This is about money? Why didn't you say so?
I'll make you talk the hard way, if I have to.
Help me, or else.
I won't break--and if you kill me, everything you've accomplished until now will be for nothing.
I'll make you a deal, Captain. Help me save Audila, and I'll see to your reward personally.
Juran, we're already on Tatooine. I just need a little time to come up with a smart play. Stand by....
Juran, stay on this holo-frequency. Let me get in touch with some contacts. We have to play this smart....
All right, I dug up everything I could about the Cheenee Rift and that Czerka mining complex. I'd say we've got a fifty-fifty shot at coming back alive.
That's your idea of good odds?
Only fifty-fifty?
Considering how the rest of our trip has gone, it's not bad.
You know what always improves the odds? Cheating.
Not if we fight dirty.
I already factored in cheating. You should've seen the original odds.
I don't know about you, but I'll definitely come out alive.
My odds are better.
Glad to know you've got my back.
Cheenee Rift has more holes in it than a chunk of Byss cheese. The Czerka mining complex sits over a network of caverns.
Czerka sealed the complex's mine shaft when they left--but didn't bother with the ore processing chute. You can use that to get inside.
And then what? That man will kill Audila if we try anything.
I'll keep this mysterious kidnapper distracted by surrendering to him while my friend sneaks up behind.
I don't like this. Using women for bait--what kind of man allows that?
You should at least wear a shield, Risha.
Good point, Corso.
It's a nice thought, but do you really believe the kidnapper will let me keep it?
Don't worry about Risha. She knows a real live hero.
I'll handle everything.
Too bad he wasn't available.
Will you get over your issues with women?
Stop being such a boy.
I don't have issues. I was raised to look after a woman, no matter how tough you are.
Uh, I meant they are. I was speaking generally.
I do.
It's not gentlemanly. Am I the last person in the galaxy with good manners?
Are you getting sweet on her? Is that your problem?
You're falling for Risha?
I don't even like her. Doesn't mean I wanna see her hurt.
If you care that much, Corso, feel free to jump in front of any blaster bolts coming my way.
What can I do to help?
Nothing. I'm not explaining to Audila how I got you killed. Just wait outside and be ready to give her a kiss.
I marked a route through the caverns to the ore chute, Captain. I'll give you a head start to get in position.
Wasn't sure I'd see you alive again, much less with that sensor computer. How'd you get it?
Diago Hixan passed away unexpectedly. Left me a generous inheritance.
He's dead? Good! I mean, for your reputation.
Sorry I didn't get a chance to chat with him before he died. My holo malfunctioned.
Really? You had "technical difficulties"?
A likely story.
Happens all the time. The suns here play havoc with comm frequencies.
That blob of a gangster took a real interest in you.
Diago was disappointed.
I'm sure he reacts like that to all the beautiful girls.
If you ever leave me hanging like that again, you'll be sorry.
Get a new one, or else.
I'm sure it'll be the last time that happens.
With that sensor computer installed, this freighter will be a first-rate scout vessel.
I'll patch it into the ship's rectenna before takeoff. You should notice a difference right away.
I expect to be warned whenever there's trouble around.
Good.
The way things go for us, we'll have to reset the alarm every other parsec.
What exactly will that gizmo do for us?
What kind of difference?
Let's just say people will have a hard time sneaking up on us in space.
If that gear breaks something on my ship, I'm holding you responsible.
Don't mess anything up.
For someone who just outsmarted the notorious Diago Hixan, you sure are grumpy.
Hang on, I'm getting a holo transmission. It's local....
Let's leave this sandball in our rear thrusters, Captain. Nok Drayen's fortune is out there waiting for us.
We need that sensor computer, Captain. Do whatever it takes to get it.
I've seen enough of Tatooine to last me a lifetime, but there's business to finish before we can leave.
Ready for a little more fun in the sun, Captain?
You bet.
What's with the sudden cheerfulness? Heat gotten to you already?
I'm signing on for another world of trouble, aren't I?
I'm already dreading it.
Just think how bored you'd be if everything went perfectly.
Welcome to the bantha tail end of space--otherwise known as Tatooine.
Hope you enjoy heat, Captain. It's the closest you'll get to landing on a sun. Unless you're really unlucky.
What cargo am I delivering to this flaming dustball?
What's the job?
No delivery here, only a pickup.
If there's credits in it, I'll go just about anywhere.
Business is business.
An attitude like that will take you far in this galaxy.
If it's that hot here, maybe we should peel off a few layers....
[Flirt] We're overdressed.
I sunburn easily. But, knock yourself out.
I hate it.
They say every year on Tatooine ages you three normal years. So, let's be quick.
We're here because of a crime lord named Diago Hixan--the closest thing Nok Drayen ever had to a rival.
Diago was always trying to one-up Nok. They fought for territory, bragging rights and the occasional woman. The battles were legendary.
What's all that to me?
Skip the history lesson.
Maybe it was Diago who killed Nok?
Looks like Diago won.
No, he never came close to beating Nok in a fight--fair or otherwise.
What started this war between Nok and Diago?
Why the rivalry?
Nok was the most successful gangster in the galaxy. Diago was never happy being number two.
Diago celebrated Nok's death by raiding one of his storehouses. Stole an advanced Gree sensor computer. Priceless technology.
To find Nok Drayen's fortune, we need to pry that sensor computer out of Diago's sticky fingers.
Everybody has a price. What's Diago's?
Let's make him an offer.
These days? Privacy.
Doesn't sound easy.
I haven't even gotten to the trouble yet.
Holding onto things is tricky when you're full of blaster holes.
He'll give it up--or die.
If you think you can kill Diago Hixan, take the shot--but you'd have to find him, first.
No one's seen Diago in years. He only communicates through his lieutenants.
One of those lieutenants, a Nikto named Tookreek, promised to help. You need to meet him.
Where do I find our new best friend?
Ready to go.
He must want something in exchange for helping us.
It can't be that simple.
Tookreek wants fame. I promised I'd tell everyone he helped find Nok Drayen's riches.
What do you know about this Tookreek?
Tell me who I'm dealing with.
If he had to choose between his parents or his criminal reputation, he'd become an orphan.
If you run into Diago, watch your back. He makes Skavak look like a Jedi Padawan.
What the blazes is a Padawan?
Jedi Padawan?
Jedi-in-training? Goody-goody students, always on their best behavior? Never mind....
Finally, a man who's my equal.
He sounds fun.
You say that like it's a good thing.
Does my favorite starship thief know about this deal?
Speaking of Skavak....
Some things I kept from Skavak, just in case. This is one of them.
I might have to shoot Diago on general principle.
Then he should die.
Should I leave the engines running, in case we have to leave on short notice?
Tookreek owns a club in the desert outside Anchorhead. He's expecting you. Good luck, Captain.
Had some last-minute business to wrap-up. We're ready to fly.
You know that old saying, "it never rains, but it pours?" Today, it's pouring holo-calls. I'm getting one from Tatooine, of all places....
He's just mad because we're leaving Alderaan first. Let's hit the hyperlanes.
I'm busy bribing a spaceport security team that had to clean up a hangar full of dead mercenaries. Answer your holo--we'll talk soon.
You're suddenly very popular. The ship's holo has a call. Better find out who it is.
I've never been so happy to see a starship part in all my life, but I'm even happier to see you in one piece.
That was the craziest run I've ever made.
What an insane job.
Then you haven't made the Varsuunian Run of Paulking Fourteen....
Security wasn't exactly tight.
It was no trouble at all.
See? Sometimes good things happen to you.
How about a kiss for coming back alive?
Show me some love.
I'm excited to see you... but not that excited.
The next time that double-crossing pirate steals from me, he dies.
Skavak's a pain in my rear.
The way things are going for us, he's not going to be a problem much longer.
I have to hand it to you, Captain. You not only took care of business, but you made Skavak look like a fool.
I worked his ship over pretty good.
And his freighter is a mess.
He'll probably just steal a new one. But at least he's a few steps behind us.
I just wish we could've settled this once and for all.
It's too bad he wasn't there.
Living well is still the best revenge. I don't know about you, but I'm having the time of my life.
I'm getting pretty good at tripping up Skavak.
My favorite activity.
The only women Skavak understands are brainless tarts. You must be tilting his galaxy.
Admit it--you're falling for me.
I'm the best, sweetheart.
I don't mix business and pleasure, Captain. Of course, someday we'll run out of business.
I also developed a profound hatred of nobles.
That's not all.
You see what I mean about these people.
I'm glad we're done here. It's funny... I can't help thinking Nok Drayen would've hated this world as much as I do.
Legend is, Nok was descended from royal blood. They say that's how he got to be "King of the Galactic Underworld" before he died.
What happened to him?
Every spacer, pirate and gangster from Abregado-rae to Yavin has a theory.
Some say he was shot in the back by a Rodian. Anyone who actually knew Nok will tell you that's ridiculous.
Others say he was killed by his most trusted lieutenant. A few say he died in his sleep.
What do you think happened to him?
What's your theory?
I think the galaxy is full of people with too much time on their hands. I try to ignore them.
I'll bet he went down swinging.
Nok was a fighter.
Mm. Nok was notoriously hard to kill.
If Nok was such a hardcase, he wouldn't be dead.
Guess he wasn't so tough.
Good point. I'll have to add that to my collection of theories.
Blood doesn't determine someone's fate.
Men aren't born kings.
Tell that to the scum Nok Drayen wiped out on his way to the top.
Kings are overrated--I'd rather be queen.
I'm not impressed.
I know exactly what you mean.
Someday I'll be king, too.
That's my destiny.
You're off to a good start. Attitude is everything.
It won't take long to wire the Arkanian hyperdrive to the ship's engines, and that anti-radiation shield will be a snap to build.
What's so special about this Arkanian hyperdrive tech?
My old hyperdrive works fine.
It's one-hundred percent accurate for thirty parsecs. Trust me, you need this.
Is there some reason I need anti-radiation shielding?
Why do I need a new shield?
You can never have too much protection. Didn't they teach you that in freighter captain school?
I'd like to help.
Like hold my hydrospanner? No, Captain, but thanks for offering.
I'll have those upgrades online in--wait, hang on--oh, this ought to be good....
Hello, Skavak. How's tricks?
Just fantasizing about killing you and your friend, sweetheart. Want to hear the details?
Did you like those special modifications I made to your ship?
How's your freighter?
You mean Senator Tal Teff from Alzoc Three's starship? I'll make sure your name comes up when he files his insurance claim.
Sorry I missed you at the spaceport, buddy.
Wish we could talk in person.
We don't want to hear your fantasies, laser brains.
Not really.
That's alright. I'll be acting them out soon enough.
Keep your disgusting thoughts to yourself. There's a lady present.
Not in front of Risha.
Boy, does she have you fooled. You're a first-rate sucker, Captain.
In my fantasy, you burn alive.
Listen to mine first.
Ha! My plan involves synthrope, a jar of dioche sauce and a starving colony of kretch insects.
Haven't you learned yet, Skavak? Cheaters never win. We're leaving Alderaan with all the prizes, and you're... well, stuck being you.
Have fun while it lasts, kids. The end of the ride is coming soon.
There's still time to get that hyperdrive back from Skavak, if you can sneak into House Thul's spaceport. Good luck.
I just got off the holo with Peema. What are you doing here? Skavak's in his docking bay!
Once you deliver that head to House Alde, we can hit the hyperlanes.
Your next delivery is to take that head in the jar to a sniveling little stuffed-shirt named Peema Ahuff.
Peema is at House Alde's estate. You'll have to sneak through some tough battle zones to get there.
Why sneak, when I have a Wookiee?
That's no fun.
Yes. Your enemies are my enemies.
You two make such a cute couple.
I'm hoping for a good fight.
Forget sneaking.
You won't be happy until you've caused an interstellar incident, will you?
House Alde?
They're Alderaan's original rulers. They've lost most of their political power but none of their snootiness.
Why does some noble need a head in a jar?
What a weird delivery.
It's a history thing. If you're that interested, ask Peema. His lectures are thrilling.
Can't wait to ditch that creepy head. I swear its eyes follow me around the cargo hold....
This is one delivery I recommend keeping covered. Let's not upset the locals any more than we need to. Good luck, Captain.
You got House Teraan's schematic--perfect. That wasn't too bad, was it?
Ask me again when the bruises heal.
Bad enough.
I sense there's a long story to go with those bruises.
Lenn is quite a flirt--and handsome.
Lord Teraan was cute.
Found time for a little rest and relaxation? Good for you.
That Cedonia was really something.
Lady Teraan was gorgeous.
Is she your "type," Captain? Interesting. She always seemed a little coldhearted to me.
I should make you do more of the work.
Next time, you go.
I have delicate hands, Captain. It would be a shame to get them dirty.
I'm slicing into a secure comm channel to eavesdrop on all the noble gossip. Don't judge me.
Alderaan certainly is the prettiest world on our itinerary. Don't let all that breathtaking scenery fool you, though.
This is the most dangerous planet of the Core Worlds. The nobles here could teach the Sith a few things about backstabbing and assassination.
Great, a planet of two-faced killers.
Just what I needed.
They say every noble who's anyone has killed at least one person, even if by accident.
There's always a catch, isn't there?
That figures.
The planet would be a paradise if it wasn't for the people.
You should hide in my bunk where it's safe.
[Flirt] I'll protect you.
Tempting, but I'll take my chances with the nobles. I'm reckless that way.
Backstabbers and assassins? I'll fit right in.
It's like coming home.
Up to a point. The nobles won't let you forget that you're beneath them.
Every so often, the noble families spill their bloodlines fighting for the throne. The current succession war is the bloodiest on record.
Since the Empire arrived to put its own puppet in charge, there's no telling who will come out on top.
Local politics put me to sleep. What's our business here?
Makes no difference to me.
Who's in the lead?
House Ulgo seized the throne, but maybe not for long. The whole planet's a war zone.
Sounds like a good place to turn a profit.
I smell opportunity.
There's nothing like political chaos to line a spacer's pockets.
The first time I visited, I thought all the nobles were so glamorous. Then I saw the truth.
These people don't know how lucky they are, or what they should do with their fortunes. They don't deserve to rule.
These nobles really upset you, don't they?
This is personal for you.
I couldn't care less about them. All that matters is getting what we came here for.
I don't have much use for aristocrats.
I agree.
You just haven't met a good one. Maybe I'll introduce you to one, someday.
I'll show these nobles a few new tricks.
They'll be easy pickings.
Just take care of our business first before you go cheating someone out of their crown jewels.
Your first delivery is a piece of glaze cake. All you have to do is escort that antique power droid to House Organa's castle.
Since House Organa runs this spaceport and their castle is right around the corner, dropping off the droid should be a quick run.
Got any info on House Organa?
Tell me about these people.
They like to present themselves as the good guys, but they're pretty shrewd politically. You won't be dealing with them, though.
The droid's my first delivery. What's the second?
What's my other delivery?
One deal at a time, Captain. Let's focus on dumping that bucket of bolts.
My favorite kind.
The droid belongs to a couple of young nobles, Lenn Teraan and his sister Cedonia. Decent people, all things considered.
Let me guess... it was a trap?
One of Skavak's old flames tried to kill me.
Yes.
I'm not even going to ask.
Everything went well. No problems at all.
[Lie] No, it was fine.
Seriously? I've been in this business too long. It's making me paranoid.
You worry too much.
Definitely.
I've heard so many stories about fake distress calls; guess they're not all traps.
The truth is, one of Skavak's ex-girlfriends just tried to kill me.
Actually, it was a trap.
I knew it! I can't believe you just lied to me.
Paranoid... or dumb?
You could try being a little nicer to me. I'm not your enemy.
Nothing I couldn't handle.
Obviously--but how much time did we lose on this fool's errand?
If there's one thing I hate, it's phony distress calls. They make spacers too paranoid to answer the real ones.
We'll be more careful, next time.
Lesson learned.
"We"? I'm always careful, Captain. Not sure you know the meaning of the word.
I'll always do what I can for my fellow spacers.
We have a duty to help.
Very noble. I wonder how much trouble that policy will buy us?
This is the last time I answer a distress call.
I'm done being nice.
See what I mean?
Let's get out of here. Deep space gives me the creeps.
I've set up some new deals on Alderaan and Tatooine. Ready to deliver the rest of this cargo?
Whatever it takes to make me rich.
You bet.
That's the spirit.
Can't wait to meet the buyer of that severed head.
Who gets the head?
Then I recommend setting course for Alderaan first. Let me know when we're there.
I'll do anything to finally get you off my ship.
Ready for you to shut up.
Well, at least you're motivated. Come see me when we're on Tatooine or Alderaan.
I hope you know what you're doing.
Hate to be nosy, but is there some reason we're docking with a decrepit starship in the middle of nowhere?
We're here on a rescue mission.
Someone's in trouble.
And who's going to rescue us if things go wrong?
Thought we'd make a little side trip.
Just sightseeing.
No straight answer. How unusual.
I need to go help a beautiful woman.
Romance calls.
You're easily distracted by shiny things, aren't you?
Shut up and get back in your bunk.
None of your business.
Be reasonable, for once in your life.
I won't tell you how to run your ship, but what am I supposed to do if you don't come back?
Boarding another vessel in deep space is tricky. A million things can go wrong.
What are you, my mother?
Quit nagging me.
No, I'm the one trying to make you rich, remember?
You know how careful I am.
I'll be fine.
When you're this far out in space, careful is beside the point.
I don't need your permission, got it?
I didn't ask your approval.
Fine. You want to get killed, why should I stop you?
You're at least planning to take some muscle, right? You do have a Wookiee.
I'll have Bowdaar tag along.
Good point.
Good. Your odds of surviving just tripled.
Thought I'd leave him behind to protect you.
He's your bodyguard.
Me? I'm not the one going into the dark and scary starship.
Take the farm boy. If you run into trouble, he'll make a good shield.
I don't need a shield, but he can watch my back.
He'll be good backup.
Have it your way--but someone that thick is useful when the shooting starts.
Why are you so eager to get Corso killed?
What's your problem with him?
I'm not--but I have no illusions about what he's good for.
Didn't know you cared so much, sweetheart.
[Flirt] You're sweet.
I just don't feel like getting stranded in deep space.
It's just a starship. How much trouble can I get in?
I'm going alone.
Famous last words.
Good luck over there. I hope you don't need it.
Ready to leave this disgusting planet whenever you are.
You got the astrogation chart, didn't you? I can tell by the look on your face.
Did you ever doubt me?
Of course I did.
If I did, you've just made me a believer for life.
You wouldn't believe how many things I had to kill.
It wasn't easy.
It's only Taris. No one will miss them.
This stupid chart better have been worth it.
I went to a lot of trouble.
You're holding a piece of underworld history.
That astrogation chart belonged to an Exchange gangster named Davik Kang.
Davik personally mapped dozens of hyperlanes between the Core and Outer Rim systems. He found shortcuts and hideouts all over the galaxy.
I've never heard of this Davik Kang.
The name means nothing to me.
He was the last great leader of the Exchange crime syndicate, and the unofficial ruler of Taris.
How'd you find out about this chart?
You know a lot.
The same way I find out about everything: listening to the right people.
How does this chart help us find Nok Drayen's riches?
That was centuries ago.
Patience. Good things come to those who trust their partners.
Have you studied much galactic history, Captain? Interesting patterns emerge, if you pay attention.
Davik Kang's criminal empire ended when this planet was destroyed. Nok Drayen's empire was born when he destroyed a planet.
Nok Drayen destroyed a whole planet?
What?
Technically, it was only a single settlement.
What a bloodthirsty creep.
That's horrible.
That's one way to look at it, assuming you're ignorant of the actual facts.
I'd like to destroy a world, someday.
He's my new hero.
I hear it's the thing to do if you want to leave your mark on the galaxy. Certainly worked for Nok.
Once upon a time, there was a pirate haven on the Outer Rim called Mandellia. Thousands of criminals lived there.
One bright morning, Nok Drayen's freighter dropped out of hyperspace over Mandellia. He demanded the pirates surrender to him or die.
What did Nok want with the pirates?
Surrender?
These pirates were successful pirates. They'd acquired a lot of wealth, and Nok decided he wanted it.
Pirates aren't known for surrendering.
I'm guessing they said no.
They weren't afraid of a lone, lightly armed freighter. They thought Nok was crazy.
Now that's what I call a negotiation.
I love this guy.
The pirates figured Nok was delusional and refused to surrender. Big mistake.
When the pirates sent their reply, Nok launched a single rocket at their settlement.
The warhead was tipped with an Imperial nerve toxin. The entire settlement died in less than a minute.
How many people did Nok murder?
What was the body count?
Ten thousand greedy pirates, give or take.
Where did Nok get an Imperial warhead?
Imperial warhead?
He stole it, of course. He'd been looking for a way to take down Mandellia in one shot, and that was the perfect solution.
I get the feeling Nok and I would've gotten along great.
I wish I'd known Nok.
He was either the best friend you could have or your very last enemy.
That day at Mandellia, Nok Drayen went from being a low-rent smuggler to one of the richest criminals in the galaxy.
Anyway, that's how the legend goes. I should probably let you get back to work.
Is there a plan to use that astrogation chart?
What about the chart?
I'll upload these coordinates into your navicomputer. It'll take a while, though. I don't recognize some of these stars.
For such a foul-smelling planet, I sure had fun.
I love my job.
Congratulations on a job well done. I definitely signed on with the right spacer.
How about some more history lessons someplace private?
[Flirt] I enjoy our chats.
You're incorrigible. Come see me when you're irresistible, and we'll talk.
You were starting to bore me.
Yes, please. Now.
Not a history buff? Too bad.
Uh-oh... sounds like someone's on your ship's holo. If they're looking for me, tell them I'm not here....
At any rate, I'm ready to leave Taris. I'm sure we can find someplace more interesting to be.
You've got a bad case of wanderlust, Risha.
You're quite the drifter.
Hey, it's one of my best qualities.
I still have business here.
Not yet, there isn't.
Please don't take too long. The smell of Taris is getting into all of my clothes.
We'll haul jets when I'm ready, understand?
Don't rush me.
You're the boss.
Get to Zone Zero and open that vault. We're running out of time.
Hope you got that vault's location. I eavesdropped on Skavak and some mercenaries over an encrypted comm channel.
They're trying to beat us to the vault. Sounds like they're closing in.
Beryl says the vault is buried in a place called "Zone Zero."
I got the vault's location.
Then we're not sunk yet. Unlike us, the mercenaries don't have the vault's exact coordinates.
Any clue what kind of numbers I'll be up against?
How many bad guys are there?
A lot less than there used to be.
Tell me where to find Skavak so I can fry him.
Skavak's here?
Don't get your hopes up. He's not on Taris--just his mercenaries.
From what I overheard, Skavak's men aren't having much luck in their search for the vault.
Something out there is eating those mercenaries alive. Literally.
For once, I'm glad Taris is a death trap.
Good for us.
The creatures are slowing the mercenaries down, but not enough.
The predators might wipe out our problem for us.
Maybe we should just wait.
I wouldn't count on it. The mercenary leader sounds pretty tough.
I'd love to be around for that slaughter.
Wish I was there.
You don't actually eat people, do you? On second thought, don't answer that.
Get to the vault fast as you can, then open the lock with this Geonosian slicer module.
It took me months to trade for this. Don't lose it, understand?
If I march all the way to Zone Zero and I'm still locked out of that vault... you're fired.
This thing better work.
Technology has come a long way since that vault was built. It'll open.
You've never heard of having a backup, genius?
What if I do, you idiot?
I have a backup--your head. I figure it can break open anything.
Stop bossing me around, got it?
Don't bark orders at me.
Don't be so thin-skinned. I'm just excited, is all.
Good luck, partner. Hope I see you again soon.
Your old partner seems to think you'll turn on me.
Beryl said not to trust you.
She's bitter about something that happened a long time ago. Forget about her.
I'll give you the benefit of the doubt. Don't make me regret it.
If you say so.
I promise you won't be disappointed.
You want me to trust you? Tell me what happened with Beryl.
You're hiding something.
You really want to do this now? Fine.
A few years ago, Beryl and I robbed an Imperial treasury station. The heist went bad.
I escaped, Beryl didn't. She blames me for not rescuing her from the Imperials.
Is there a reason you left your friend to rot?
Why didn't you?
I was saving my own skin. I don't apologize for that.
How'd Beryl escape the Empire?
Obviously someone did.
She didn't. The Imperials sold her to a Hutt and she escaped from him. Wasn't pleasant, from what I hear.
I don't blame her a bit for hating you.
I would, too.
Neither do I.
Regardless, I don't work with walking liabilities, anymore. That's why I'm with you.
Let's get what we came for and haul jets off this lousy planet, all right?
If you cross me, I'll shove you out the air lock.
Betray me, and you're dead.
You've made that very clear. Don't worry, I enjoy being alive.
If I die, lock up before you leave.
Me too.
Not funny.
I'll be waiting, Captain.
I'm busy monitoring some interesting comm traffic. Come back when you know where the vault is.
I'm scanning the holofrequencies for anything on Skavak. Nothing so far.
Do whatever it takes to get Beryl's cooperation. There's too much at stake.
It's probably best if you don't bring up my name when you talk to Beryl.
Ah, Taris. Did you know you've just landed on the biggest graveyard in the galaxy?
There's not much to enjoy here besides skeletons, ruins and man-eating creatures.
As long as there's a cantina, I'm happy.
And a good drink?
Are all your inoculations up to date? I doubt the watering holes here rate more than a "one" in Trampeta's Star Guide.
Wanna fly someplace else?
Sounds awful.
No point in that, is there? We'd only have to come back.
It's the perfect romantic getaway, sweetheart.
[Flirt] And you.
Don't flatter yourself, flyboy--and for the record, I prefer my cities intact.
Not really. I'll be here in a nice cozy bunk. You're the one who has to go out.
Taris was "The Coruscant of the Outer Rim" until some lunatic leveled it centuries ago. Now it's a toxic swamp.
We're here for an astrogation chart that was in a vault when Taris fell. That vault's somewhere in these ruins.
How do you know the vault still exists?
You're sure about that?
It was built to withstand anything short of a supernova.
What do we need with some musty old astrogation chart?
Astrogation chart?
I worry about the "why" and you take care of the "how." That's our deal, remember?
Guess you'd better grab a vibroshovel and start digging.
Then you should get to work.
I don't dig, Captain. I supervise.
Our lost vault was designed to be recovered after a major catastrophe. All we need are the right sensors to locate it.
The catch is, the only person I know with access to those sensors is someone who hates me.
I smell a good story.
Why is that?
Let's just say she and I have a "history"... which I might tell you when I know you better.
Who else has access to the sensors?
That's our only option?
We don't have time to find out, but luckily we don't have to.
Someone hates you? But you're so... likeable.
Aw, poor Risha.
Try not to slip on your own sarcasm. I wouldn't want you to break anything--yet.
I made our contact an irresistible offer. One of the deal's terms is that she doesn't have to see me.
I need you to get that vault's location, Captain. Impress the stars out of her.
I'll do whatever it takes.
Consider it done.
This woman talks tough, but underneath, she's a softie. Use that to your advantage.
I'm sure you will. You seem like her type of man.
People always tell me how impressive I am.
I'll impress her.
That must be a terrible burden for you.
How about I just beat the answers out of her?
A good punch is quicker.
We need to play it cool until we have what we want.
I should also warn you, Skavak knows about the vault. We can't let him catch up.
Relax, this is me we're talking about
Don't worry.
And I have every confidence in you--well, almost every.
I'm curious how you know what Skavak's up to.
How are you so sure?
He wasted a lot of breath trying to impress me into his bunk. It never worked, but I learned a lot about his plans.
All I want to do is kill that guy.
It's the only way to get him.
Don't get hung up on your vendetta. Living well really is the best revenge.
The astrogation chart in that vault is essential to finding Nok Drayen's riches, Captain. Your contact's name is Beryl Thorne.
When Beryl gives you the vault's location, come back and see me. Oh, and try not to let anything eat you.
What do you say we test out your new engine?
Just in time. I installed that new engine for you. Want to take it for a spin?
That was fast work, Risha.
Already?
Swapping out starship engines is easy. Mechanics just want you to think it's complicated, so they can charge more credits.
Where did you learn to be a starship mechanic?
Let's talk about you, first.
At my father's knee. He was the best.
Why did we need a new engine? What's wrong with the old one?
Was this really necessary?
Let's just say this one will bring us a lot closer to what we're after.
If you messed up my ship, you'll pay.
It better work.
Relax, I know my way around a starship.
This prototype is really something. You'll find your ship is a lot more maneuverable.
I notice we have a new addition to the crew. Wookiees are always good for extra muscle. Is this one friendly?
His name's Bowdaar, and he's as sweet as they come.
Yes.
Really? Because an angry Wookiee can come in handy.
If I say the word, he'll pull your arms right out of their sockets.
Only if I tell him to be.
Aw, you have a new best friend. Corso must be so hurt.
Kick him in the shins and find out.
Learn the hard way.
I'd rather scratch him behind his ears. Wookiees like that, you know.
You did well here, Captain. It can be difficult to deal with Drooga.
It's funny that a Hutt is helping us find Nok Drayen's treasures. Nok used to terrify the Cartel.
I didn't think Hutts feared anything.
That's hard to believe.
They didn't until they met Nok.
You know a lot about this obscure gangster.
You're just full of trivia.
Obscure gangster? People have written massive holochronicles about him. Not my fault you've been living under a rock.
Twenty years ago, Nok single-handedly killed half the Cartel members in a single night. No one ever figured out how he did it.
The surviving Cartel members gave Nok control over an entire galactic quadrant as a gesture of respect. The Hutts never took it back.
What are they afraid of, Nok's ghost?
But he's dead.
Better to be safe than deceased, I guess.
Who runs the territory now that Nok is dead?
Who inherited it?
The crime bosses who tried to take over... all died under mysterious circumstances.
People are gonna fear me even more than they did Nok.
That's how I want to be known.
Well, it's good to have goals.
We're closer than ever to finding Nok Drayen's lost wealth, Captain. Let's keep up the chase, shall we?
The only thing interesting about Nok is his lost fortune.
I couldn't care less.
Then let's get back to finding it.
Hmm... someone's calling on the ship's holo. Probably a fan. Be a darling and tell them I'm out.
As much as I love Nar Shaddaa, I hate staying in one place for too long.
I'm feeling a bit restless, myself.
Me too.
Prepare for takeoff, people.
Strap in.
Ready to go!
I can't wait to see these new engines in action.
We're not going anywhere. I still have business.
Cool your jets.
You're going to make me wait to see these engines in action, huh? Have it your way.
Hmm? You caught me napping. My friends can be very exhausting. It's probably good I don't live here.
Nar Shaddaa is the only place to shop. I just bought these rancor boots on the Promenade. What do you think?
I didn't know rancors had such small feet.
You're cute.
Ha ha. Seriously, you should feel these things. They fit like shimmersilk.
How much did those cost?
They look expensive.
I never look at a price tag. Why bother? I'm just going to buy it anyway.
It's about time you started modeling for me.
[Flirt] Twirl around.
Don't get your hopes up. The other things I bought might make you blind.
Disgusting. You should take them back.
They're awful!
You really think so? Hmph. Guess I'll stick with the old synthetic ones, for now.
So, are you the most honest man in the world or just trying to hurt my feelings? Forget it.
Figured it was safe to step out and shop after Drooga finally answered my holo. I understand we've hit a snag.
You think the Hutt's conning us?
I don't trust Drooga.
You've met him. Do you think Drooga has the attention span to con anyone?
After Skavak, it's refreshing to meet someone so dependable.
Last time I checked, you were leaving everything up to me.
"We"?
And that hasn't changed. I have complete faith in you.
Since we'll be here a while longer, I'd like to catch up with some old friends. Good luck with Drooga.
You're not staying here?
Leaving again?
I'll be in and out. The ship is secure.
What are you gonna do if I haul jets off Nar Shaddaa?
What if I leave the planet?
I won't let you take off without me.
You go back to doing what you're best at--wasting my time.
Thanks for nothing.
See you later, Captain.
I love Nar Shaddaa. This is the place to get everything you never knew you wanted.
The only laws are the ones people make with bribes or blasters. It's good to be home again.
Nar Shaddaa is your homeworld?
Home?
I was born in space, but this has always felt like home.
There's no government here at all?
Sounds like anarchy.
Who needs a government when you have a Hutt Cartel controlling everything?
Good thing I have plenty of credits and ammo.
No laws works for me.
Always a smart policy.
Maybe you can show me the sights, gorgeous.
[Flirt] Give me a tour.
Nice try, but we're here on business, not pleasure.
There's a Hutt here named Drooga who has a prototype starship engine. We need it to find Nok Drayen's fortune.
Drooga and I made a deal. He'll trade the starship engine for that caged beast.
How can that slobbering creature be worth a ship engine?
Strange deal.
It's the last male shanjaru in the galaxy. The species is pretty much extinct. That makes it valuable.
No job is simple when a Hutt's involved.
This won't go well.
Drooga is far from the worst Hutt I've dealt with. When he gets crazy, just smile and nod.
I hope you're not expecting me to drag all this around.
I can only carry so much.
Freight droids will handle all the heavy lifting when the time comes.
Drooga's hosting a giant moving party on his "pleasure barge." It stops periodically at different locations. Right now, it's on the Promenade.
I sent Drooga several messages, but he never replied. You'll have to make contact the old-fashioned way.
I can't wait to see what kind of party this Hutt throws.
Sounds fun.
It's a shrine to grotesque extravagance. Rich lowlifes from across the galaxy spend a fortune attending Drooga's gatherings.
I smell trouble.
Don't worry. Drooga's feasts are elaborate forty-course meals. He's probably too busy gorging himself to bother with a holo.
I'll teach that Hutt a lesson in manners.
That rude little worm.
Rich people can afford to be rude--and Drooga's as rich as they come.
Before you go, one more thing... I know there's a price on your head from Rogun the Butcher over some business on Ord Mantell.
Word on the HoloNet is, Rogun's personal bounty hunter is here on Nar Shaddaa. His name's Zank Helrott. Watch out for him.
You think Zank is here for me?
Thanks for the tip.
It may only be a coincidence, but better safe than sorry.
Who told you about the price on my head?
How did you find all this out?
I ran a background check on you before we left Coruscant. A girl can't be too careful.
Zank had better watch out for me.
If I see him, he's dead.
He's no amateur, and he's never brought in a bounty alive.
The sooner we finish our business with Drooga, the sooner we can be someplace Zank Helrott isn't. Have fun at the party....
I've set the droid to follow you to the delivery point. Good luck, Captain.
You will.
Nervous, little girl?
I'm handling it.
Good luck, Captain. I'm counting on you.
